oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NUMERICAL AND EXPERIMENTAL INVESTIGATION OF WAVE LOADS ON MOUND BREAKWATER HEADS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sevindik, Cem
Senturk, Baris Ufuk
Demir, Furkan
Guler, Hasan Gokhan
Baykal, Cuneyt
Tarakcioglu, Gulizar Ozyurt
Guler, Isıkhan
Yalciner, Ahmet Cevdet
Ergin, Aysen
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The head section of the conventional mound breakwaters is more critical than the trunk section because of wave breaking and refraction induced “high cone-overflow velocities”, and reduction in neighboring unit support (CIRIA et al., 2007; USACE, 2011). Therefore, the utilization of heavier armor units for the head section part is a widely accepted practice. As given in the literature, the lee-side of the head section is exposed to more damage than the other parts of the head section. However, the relation between the damage that occurs at the lee-side and the physical processes has not been studied in detail yet. In the scope of this study, the wave-breaking induced loading on Antifer units at the lee-side of a mound breakwater head was investigated by conducting both physical model experiments and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) modeling studies.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; structures.86
